questions.text: What is the primary purpose of an attack bridge simulation?
options: To simulate the creation of network topologies
To simulate the analysis of financial risks
To simulate real-world cyber attacks for training and testing purposes
To simulate the design of physical security systems
questions.correctAnswer: To simulate real-world cyber attacks for training and testing purposes

questions.text: Which of the following is not a usage of the MITRE ATT&CK framework?
What does "Resource Development" refer to in the context of MITRE ATT&CK?
options: The phase where an attacker establishes persistence on a target system
The process of gathering public information about a target organization
The tactic where adversaries develop, purchase, or acquire resources needed for future operations
The stage of exploiting known vulnerabilities in target systems
The phase involving cleanup and anti-forensic actions after an attack
questions.correctAnswer: The tactic where adversaries develop, purchase, or acquire resources needed for future operations

questions.text: An attacker uses command injection to run a command on a web server host. Which MITRE ATT&CK tactic does this fall under?
What is the difference in responsibilities between the red team and blue team in cybersecurity?
options: The red team finds vulnerabilities by simulating attacks, while the blue team responds to incidents and defends against attacks.
The red team emulates attacks to find vulnerabilities, while the blue team creates security policies.
The red team defends against cyber threats, while the blue team finds vulnerabilities by breaking through defenses
The red team monitors network traffic for threats, while the blue team responds to incidents and creates defenses.
